  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath1 be a smooth projective variety over an algebraically closed field .",
    "assume that the picard group @xmath2 is freely generated by the classes of divisors @xmath3 .",
    "the , or , of @xmath1 with respect to this choice is given by @xmath4 with multiplication induced by product of functions in the function field of @xmath1 .",
    "the cox rings of certain classes of varieties are particularly simple . in the case of toric varieties , for instance",
    ", the cox ring is the ring of polynomial functions on an affine space @xmath5 with coordinates indexed by the torus - invariant divisors @xcite*theorem  2.1 .",
    "moreover , the variety @xmath1 can be recovered as a quotient of an open subset of @xmath6 by the action of a torus . more generally , any smooth projective variety @xmath1 with a _ finitely generated _ cox ring can be described in this way : there is an open subset @xmath7 of @xmath8 with a canonical torus action and the quotient of @xmath7 by this action is isomorphic to @xmath1 .",
    "the space @xmath7 is an example of a ( see  @xcite for a foundational treatment of universal torsors ) .",
    "varieties @xmath1 with finitely generated cox ring are also distinguished amongst all varieties : the minimal model program on @xmath1 can be carried out for any divisor .",
    "this privileged position has earned such varieties the name of @xcite*definition  1.10 . determining which varieties are mori dream spaces remains a difficult problem , even in the case of surfaces . in this paper",
    "we are primarily interested in the case in which @xmath1 is a smooth rational surface with big anticanonical divisor .",
    "we prove the following result .",
    "let @xmath1 be a smooth rational surface such that @xmath9 is big .",
    "then the cox ring of @xmath1 is finitely generated .",
    "this result extends a theorem of hassett @xcite*theorem  5.7 , which states that a smooth rational surface with big and nef anticanonical divisor is a mori dream space .",
    "as we were completing this paper , we learned that chen and schnell obtained an independent proof of theorem  [ eccolo ]  @xcite .",
    "[ first examples ] we deduce from theorem  [ eccolo ] that the surfaces in the following list are mori dream spaces ( see remark  [ first examples explained ] ) .    1 .   rational surfaces with @xmath10 , or equivalently , rational surfaces with @xmath11 , are mori dream spaces.[kx pos ] 2 .",
    "blow - ups of the hirzebruch surface @xmath12 , @xmath13 at any number of points lying in the union of the negative curve and @xmath14 distinct fibers of the projection.[hirz s at lots ] 3 .",
    "blow - ups of @xmath0 at @xmath14 points , @xmath15 of which lie on a ( possibly reducible ) conic.[p2 on a conic ] 4 .   the surface obtained by blowing up @xmath0 at the ten points of pairwise intersections of five general lines ( figure  [ pentagramma ] ) .",
    "generators for the cox ring of this surface are determined in  @xcite .",
    "harbourne and ro have also shown that the surface in question is a mori dream space  ( @xcite).[castravet ] 5 .",
    "the surface obtained by considering three distinct lines @xmath16 in @xmath0 and blowing up the three pairwise intersections and @xmath17 , @xmath18 and @xmath19 additional points on @xmath20 and @xmath21 respectively.[e8 ]    to further illustrate the applicability of theorem  [ eccolo ] , we classify blow - ups of @xmath0 at finite sets of points for which @xmath9 is both big and effective ( theorem  [ classi ] ) .",
    "the classification is achieved by associating a root system to each big rational surface , extending a well - known construction for del pezzo surfaces ( section  [ radici ] ) .",
    "there are smooth projective rational surfaces with finitely generated cox ring , whose anticanonical divisor is not big .",
    "for example , by  @xcite*theorem  5.2 the surface @xmath1 obtained by blowing up the nine inflection points of a smooth plane cubic has finitely generated cox ring .",
    "however , the anticanonical divisor @xmath9 is not big since @xmath22 contains an irreducible curve and @xmath23 .",
    "smooth rational surfaces with big anticanonical class have been studied before .",
    "sakai showed that their anticanonical models have only isolated rational singularities and he provided numerous examples of them ( @xcite ) .",
    "harbourne studied the effective and nef cones for rational surfaces with @xmath24 in  @xcite , while  @xcite proves that the subsemigroup of effective curves is finitely generated for the same class of surfaces .",
    "the surfaces appearing in theorem  [ classi ]  ( ii ) ,  ( iii ) below have been studied by failla , lahyane and molica bisci in  @xcite ; in particular , they investigated the finite generation of the monoid of effective divisor classes modulo algebraic equivalence on these surfaces .      a log del pezzo surface ( i.e. , a kawamata log terminal pair @xmath25 such that @xmath1 is a normal surface and @xmath26 is @xmath27-cartier and ample ) is a mori dream space @xcite*corollary  1.3.1 . clearly , log del pezzo surfaces have big anticanonical class .",
    "it is natural to wonder if the converse is true .",
    "it is not . in ",
    "[ esempi ] we give a family of examples , suggested to us by chenyang xu , which shows that the class of smooth rational surfaces with big anticanonical class is strictly larger than the class of log del pezzo surfaces .",
    "we thank ana - maria castravet , johan de jong , david eisenbud , brian harbourne , brendan hassett , sen keel , bjorn poonen , burt totaro and chenyang xu for helpful conversations during the completion of this work .",
    "from now on , unless otherwise specified , @xmath1 denotes a smooth projective rational surface over an algebraically closed field with big anticanonical divisor @xmath9 .",
    "we note that @xmath2 is a free abelian group and that @xmath28 .",
    "let @xmath29 be the @xmath30-vector space of numerical equivalence classes of curves on @xmath1 ; let @xmath31 be the cone in @xmath29 of non - negative real combinations of classes of curves on @xmath1 and let @xmath32 be its closure .",
    "we denote by @xmath33 the cone of non - negative integral linear combinations of classes of curves on @xmath1 .",
    "[ andra ] let @xmath1 be a smooth projective rational surface such that @xmath9 is big .",
    "the cone of effective divisors on @xmath1 is finitely generated .",
    "in particular , there are only finitely many integral curves with negative square contained on @xmath1 .",
    "if the dimension of @xmath29 is at most two , then @xmath1 is either isomorphic to @xmath0 or to a hirzebruch surface and the result is clear .",
    "if the dimension of @xmath29 is at least three , then the result follows from  @xcite*proposition  3.3 .",
    "the last statement also follows from @xcite*proposition  4.4 .",
    "[ hodge ] let @xmath1 be a smooth projective surface , let @xmath34 be a big and nef divisor , and let @xmath35 be an effective divisor such that @xmath36 .",
    "if @xmath37 are distinct irreducible components of @xmath38 , then the matrix @xmath39 is negative definite , and @xmath40 .    since @xmath34 is nef we have @xmath41 for all @xmath42 .",

    "thus the vectors @xmath46 , \\ldots , [ c_r ] \\in n_1(x)$ ] are independent and the result follows since they are all contained in the hyperplane orthogonal to @xmath34 .    [ sezioni ] let @xmath34 be a nef divisor on @xmath1 not linearly equivalent to zero .    1",
    ".   [ sislin ] we have @xmath47 and the linear system @xmath48 has dimension at least one .",
    "[ genar ] if @xmath35 is an effective divisor such that @xmath36 , then the arithmetic genus of @xmath38 is non - positive ; in particular every reduced connected component of @xmath38 has arithmetic genus zero and every integral component of @xmath38 is a smooth rational curve .",

    "we conclude by applying the riemann - roch formula to the divisor @xmath34 , together with serre duality and the fact that @xmath54 is the opposite of a big divisor and is therefore not effective .",
    "( [ genar ] ) since @xmath1 is rational we have @xmath55 . from the exact sequence @xmath56 we deduce that @xmath57",

    "the result is clear if @xmath65 ; thus from now on we assume that @xmath66 . by lemma  [ sezioni ]  ( [ sislin ] ) ,",
    "@xmath34 is linearly equivalent to an effective divisor , and we therefore reduce to the case in which @xmath34 is effective . if @xmath67 , where @xmath68 , @xmath69 are nef divisors , then both @xmath68 and @xmath69 are not big , since otherwise @xmath34 would be big , and it suffices to show the result for @xmath68 and @xmath69 separately .",
    "thus we reduce to the case in which @xmath34 is not the sum of two non - zero nef divisors , since the nef cone contains no lines .",
    "write @xmath70 , where @xmath71 are distinct prime divisors and @xmath72 are integers .",
    "the matrix @xmath73 is symmetric and has non - negative off - diagonal entries .",
    "moreover , if @xmath74 is a subset such that for all @xmath75 and all @xmath76 we have @xmath77 , then @xmath78 and @xmath79 are nef divisors whose sum equals @xmath34 . by our reductions , it follows that one of @xmath68 , @xmath69 equals zero and therefore that either @xmath80 , or @xmath81 .",
    "thus @xmath82 is an irreducible matrix .    by the perron - frobenius theorem",
    ", the largest eigenvalue @xmath83 of @xmath82 has an eigenvector @xmath84 with positive entries .",
    "if @xmath83 were positive , then the effective divisor @xmath85 would be nef and big , and thus @xmath34 would itself be big , contradicting the assumptions .",
    "since @xmath86 , the largest eigenvalue of @xmath82 is zero , and by the perron - frobenius theorem it has multiplicity one .",
    "therefore every effective divisor @xmath51 supported on @xmath87 satisfies @xmath88 , with equality if and only if @xmath51 is proportional to @xmath34 .",
    "write @xmath89 , where @xmath90 is the fixed divisor of @xmath48 and @xmath91 is a divisor such that @xmath92 has no base component ; in particular we have @xmath93 .",

    "we deduce that @xmath48 has no fixed component .",
    "finally , @xmath48 has no base points since the number of its base points is at most @xmath97 .",
    "[ bigbpf ] if @xmath34 is a big and nef divisor on @xmath1 , then @xmath34 is semiample .",

    "it follows that @xmath34 is linearly equivalent to a divisor whose support is disjoint from @xmath38 , and therefore @xmath34 is the pull - back of a cartier divisor @xmath100 on @xmath98 . by the nakai - moishezon criterion ,",
    "the divisor @xmath100 is ample and hence it is semiample .",
    "thus its pull - back @xmath34 is semiample , as we wanted to show .",
    "we prove a weaker version of  @xcite*theorem  1 .",
    "[ genefa ] the cox ring of @xmath1 is generated by global sections supported on the curves with negative self - intersection and generators of the subring @xmath101 .",

    "is finitely generated .",

    "there are only finitely many curves with negative self - intersection on @xmath1 .",
    "thus the result follows from lemma  [ genefa ] .",

    "the following family of examples shows that there exist smooth rational surfaces @xmath1 with big anticanonical divisor which are not log del pezzo .",

    "in this section we classify blow - ups @xmath1 of @xmath0 at finite sets of points for which @xmath9 is both big and effective .",
    "we do so by associating a root system to each big rational surface , extending a well - known construction for del pezzo surfaces  @xcite*section  iv.25 .",
    "[ bigma ] let @xmath1 be a smooth projective surface and let @xmath186 be a set of integral curves on @xmath1 .",
    "there is a big divisor whose support is contained in @xmath186 if and only if the lattice @xmath187 is negative definite .",
    "( @xmath188 ) suppose that @xmath187 is negative definite .",
    "by the hodge index theorem , there is a divisor @xmath189 such that @xmath190 . by riemann - roch and serre",
    "duality , @xmath191 grows ( at least ) quadratically in @xmath192 and the same statement holds for @xmath193 . since @xmath194 it follows that @xmath195 and @xmath196 can not both grow quadratically .",
    "we deduce that either @xmath197 or @xmath198 is a big divisor and the result follows .",
    "( @xmath199 ) suppose that @xmath189 is a big divisor with @xmath200 for all @xmath201 .",
    "adding non - negative multiples of the curves in @xmath186 to @xmath197 we reduce to the case in which @xmath197 is effective ; thus the base locus of @xmath197 is supported on @xmath186 .",
    "it suffices to show that there exists a big and nef divisor @xmath34 in the integral span of @xmath186 , since then @xmath43 and @xmath202 is negative definite by the hodge index theorem .",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we prove that the cox ring of a smooth rational surface with big anticanonical class is finitely generated . </S>",
    "<S> we classify surfaces of this type that are blow - ups of @xmath0 at distinct points lying on a ( possibly reducible ) cubic . </S>"
  ]
}
